text:
I have a seemingly simple to solve issue, but for some reason, I can't figure it out.

I'm working on this page: <https://www-airsquirrels-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/reflector/director?hs_preview=ghyxIpwc-48585141100>

And in the second section, I have 5 images. One of the images - the one above Manage Connect Devices has a shadow on the png file itself, it's not created with CSS.

Because of that the shadow is taking up space in the div and making the image appear smaller than the others.

Any idea how I can size the images similar to the others even though it has a shadow on it?

I thought about just asking for the image without the shad and then adding it via CSS but had a hunch I'm just overlooking something that may be a simpler solution.

You can do some hacks…but i don’t recommend that…

1. Use 122px height for that image 
2. Use bottom negative margin 22px to pull the below content up
Note : it will not work in case you change your image, so use image without shadow would be the best solution :wink:
